items.title: What even is an AI Agent?!
items.content:encoded:
Watch the https://bolt.new Reward Ceremony Live!
July 26th 10AM PST on https://www.twitch.tv/theprimeagen
#sponsored https://balls.yoga
üìå Chapters:
00:00:00 - balls.yoga, drama & intro
00:02:00 - Building OpenCode: terminal AI agents

00:04:08 - What is an AI Agent?
00:05:00 - Prompt engineering and tool calling
00:06:10 - OpenCode UX and mobile plans
00:07:27 - Why OpenCode runs agents locally
00:08:34 - Vision for mobile remote dev workflows
00:09:15 - The reality of build opencode

00:13:32 - Tool usage & LSP integration
00:14:20 - LSP tool feedback loop
00:17:00 - Claude is best at calling tools
00:18:10 - Prompt tuning limitations and expectations
00:22:20 - Modeling agent loops with tool calls

00:26:20 - Security tradeoffs in early development

00:30:40 - Parallel sessions and subagents

‚Ä¢ Humor, Twitch drama & voice AI characters

items.title: WTF Typescript?
items.content:encoded:
Trash presents his Typescript presentation from Render ATL (Sorry if you are audio only listener)

üîó Sponsored by Sentry https://sentry.io | Code breaks, fix it faster

üìå Chapters:

00:00:00 - Intro
00:00:42 - Who‚Äôs actually a ‚Äúweb developer‚Äù?
00:02:31 - Trash‚Äôs live intro & TypeScript presentation setup
00:03:59 - Sentry #ad
00:04:38 - Excess property checks in TS
00:09:42 - WTF: Object spreads silence type errors
00:14:30 - React prop spreading madness
00:18:22 - Structural vs duck typing debate
00:24:00 - WTF: Enums and why everyone hates them
00:27:45 - Enum strings vs numbers behavior
00:33:10 - Why enums in Node are cursed
00:36:55 - Safer enum alternatives using const objects
00:43:10 - TS quirks: Boolean filter keeps undefined in types
00:46:40 - TSReset: The ‚ÄúCSS reset‚Äù for TypeScript
00:49:01 - WTF: Empty object {} lets everything through
00:52:32 - Doom rendered in TypeScript type system
00:54:00 - Type-level math in TS (it‚Äôs real)
00:56:33 - Scaling hell: TS performance bottlenecks
01:00:01 - Flamegraphs and fighting TS perf without docs
01:04:55 - TS inference vs explicit typing in large codebases
01:09:30 - Prime‚Äôs favorite TS bug strikes again
01:14:01 - Casey breaks down the compiler logic
01:17:50 - Is this a TypeScript bug or a feature?
01:22:44 - Final thoughts and community love

---

**Topics Covered:**

‚Ä¢ TypeScript excess property checks
‚Ä¢ Enums vs object literals
‚Ä¢ Structural vs duck typing
‚Ä¢ TS compiler edge cases
‚Ä¢ WTFs that break your mental model
‚Ä¢ Type-level math
‚Ä¢ Performance debugging hell
‚Ä¢ Massive monorepo pain points
‚Ä¢ The one TypeScript bug Prime can‚Äôt let go

items.title: Keyboard Show & Tell
items.content:encoded:
üîó Sponsored by Code Rabbit
https://coderabbit.link/primeagen-vscode

‚∏ª

üéπ Finding the Right Keyboard

Welcome to The Standup ‚Äì where developers, creators, and founders debate the big questions. In this episode, we talk about all things Keyboards.

We dive deep into:

- Keyboard Obsession Origins
- Mechanical Keyboards 101: Switch types, thock vs. clicky, creamy vs. crispy
- Keychron, GMMK Pro, Dactyl Manuform & Voyager Reviews
- Box Switches & Keycap Profiles (Cherry, DSA, OEM)
- Silent Switches vs. Clicky Switches Debate
- Typing Ergonomics & Wrist Pain Fixes
- Split Keyboards, Thumb Clusters, and Concavity Explained
- Custom Keyboards with RGB & Anime Keycaps
- Keyboard Lubing
- ZMK vs. QMK Keyboard Programming
- Typing Competitions & Internet Speed Typing Lore
- Casey‚Äôs Journey: From Amiga to Custom Builds
- ASMR & Key Sounds Showcase
- Trash‚Äôs Keyboard Garage Sale Finds
- Ergonomic vs. Aesthetic Keyboards
- How Much is Too Much for a Keyboard?

‚∏ª

items.title: Is College Worth It? (ft. DHH)
items.content:encoded:
üîó Sponsored by Code Rabbit
https://coderabbit.link/primeagen-vscode

‚∏ª

üéì Is College Still Worth It in 2025?

Welcome to The Standup ‚Äì where developers, creators, and founders debate the big questions. In this episode, we sit down with David Heinemeier Hansson (DHH), the creator of Ruby on Rails and Basecamp co-founder.

üëâ Is College Worth It in 2025?

We dive deep into:

‚è≥ The ROI of college in a post-AI world
üá∫üá∏ Why American higher ed is broken (from a Danish POV)
üìâ Are CS degrees still worth $250K?
üí∏ The myth of the ‚Äúfour-year luxury cruise‚Äù
ü§ñ How AI is disrupting the junior dev job market
üîç Hiring: Is college even a useful signal anymore?
üß† IQ vs wisdom vs vibes ‚Äì what really matters in hiring
üß∞ Is programming a trade? Should we move to apprenticeships?
üë®‚Äçüåæ Why every dev wants to be a farmer (and why that‚Äôs delusional)

Whether you‚Äôre considering college, hiring devs, or already knee-deep in student debt, this conversation pulls no punches and may just change how you think about education, hiring, and the future of software development.

‚∏ª

üìå Chapters:
0:00 intro
2:05 is college still worth it in 2025?
5:48 the cost of college in the U.S. vs Europe
6:57 sponsor: CodeRabbit
7:42 good point
9:10 DHH explains the Danish education system
13:02 is college just a luxury cruise?
17:45 what are you actually buying with a degree?
21:20 how companies *really* hire developers
26:11 Casey‚Äôs take: programming should be a trade
30:40 is college a filter for IQ or just vibes?
45:50 what skills matter more than a degree
49:20 how to actually learn to code in 2025
53:00 is college redeemable? final thoughts
57:15 wrap-up & what‚Äôs next on the podcast

Why Do Game Developers STILL Use Windows?? | The Standup
üéÆüíª In this episode of Standup, we dive deep into the eternal operating system war: Windows vs. macOS vs. Linux. Legendary game dev Casey Muratori (of Handmade Hero fame) joins Primeagen, Trash, and Tee to unpack why game developers still use Windows, even when most modern developers swear by Linux or Mac.

üìå Topics We Cover:
‚Ä¢ Why game devs prefer Windows (spoiler: it‚Äôs not because they like it)
‚Ä¢ MacOS vs. Linux vs. Windows for developers
‚Ä¢ Is GDB actually garbage?
‚Ä¢ Debugging tools: RAD Debugger, Visual Studio, and why Linux falls short
‚Ä¢ Why enterprise studios can‚Äôt just switch to Linux
‚Ä¢ Anti-cheat, Steam Deck, and the future of Linux gaming
‚Ä¢ The unbearable pain of Windows terminals
‚Ä¢ Why developers obsess over window managers and productivity setups
‚Ä¢ And of course‚Ä¶ the real debate: should devs optimize everything or just get stuff done?

üî• Whether you‚Äôre a web developer, game dev, Linux power user, or someone just trying to survive corporate IT policies ‚Äî this one hits every nerve.

üëá DROP YOUR OS HOT TAKES IN THE COMMENTS üëá

Why Do Game Developers STILL Use Windows?? | The Standup
üéÆüíª In this episode of Standup, we dive deep into the eternal operating system war: Windows vs. macOS vs. Linux. Legendary game dev Casey Muratori (of Handmade Hero fame) joins Primeagen, Trash, and Tee to unpack why game developers still use Windows, even when most modern developers swear by Linux or Mac.
